image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket and sunglasses

props.synopsis: The chief executive of the Northern Territory's biggest legal aid provider has rejected a $1.5 million offer from the agency to settle a long-running Federal Court case.

title.children: NAAJA CEO seeking upward of $1.5m in damages after unlawful sacking

image.altText: A man wearing dark-rimmed glasses and a police uniform speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: NT Police Assistant Commissioner Michael White said this was a "very significant event" that has caused "significant shock to the community".

title.children: Man, 22, charged over alleged rape of woman in Alice Springs

image.altText: Two young men next to each other and smiling - one sitting on a low wall and the other standing,

props.synopsis: Omar Faruk's best friend was killed in violent home invasion in Darwin. He's now on a mission to fulfill his friend's dream of studying in Australia.

title.children: Darwin students fulfil friend's dream after his violent break-in death

image.altText: A pool table in the foreground with a young player obscured in the background

props.synopsis: As Alice Springs residents brace for a potential summer crime spike, a youth centre offers a place where children can feel safe and have a "sense of belonging".

title.children: Alice Springs youth centre aims to head off summer crime spree

image.altText: A cyclist riding along a path on a riverbank

props.synopsis: Darwin Cycling Club is refusing to join a national redress scheme for child sexual abuse survivors, saying it should not be held financially liable for an historic allegation from more than 30 years ago.

title.children: NT sports club refuses to join redress scheme due to sex assault claim

image.altText: A toddler is crying amid piles of debris in the aftermath of Cyclone Tracy in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Fifty years ago, Cyclone Tracy changed the lives of those who lived through it. But it has also fundamentally changed the rule book to building in Australia.

title.children: Cyclone Tracy destroyed Darwin and nails are partly to blame

image.altText: St John paramedics face high levels of violence in comparison to other states and territories.

props.synopsis: Frontline workers at the Northern Territory's troubled private ambulance service are calling for a government overhaul of St John NT following a damning report into its governance and culture.

title.children: NT paramedics fear 'failing their patients' due to poor governance

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: Calls made by prominent public officials for the riot squad and a federal takeover of the Northern Territory are contained in a list of "sensitivities" about the Alice Springs youth curfew.

title.children: Public servants too 'sensitive' on Alice Springs youth curfew

props.synopsis: ABC global affairs editor John Lyons analyses the aftermath of the revolt that toppled Bashar al-Assad's government.

title.children: What the future holds for Syria following the fall of Assad

image.altText: Close up, side shot of Mark Butler.

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler has called out "product phoenixing" — when health insurers close existing "gold" policies to new customers, but then introduce new, almost identical policies at a higher cost.

title.children: Underhanded, secret and legal: Minister vows crackdown on insurance loophole

image.altText: A Syrian opposition fighter sits inside an office at the Presidential Palace

props.synopsis: With ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his family in Russia, his presidential palace is vacant and people are taking selfies and making off with the furniture.

title.children: Inside fallen Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad's now-looted presidential palace

image.altText: Bali Nine pair, Si Yi Chen and Matthew Norman, sit staring at the camera

props.synopsis: Australians Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Si-Yi Chen, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj are serving life sentences in Indonesia for their roles in a drug smuggling plot in 2005.

title.children: Indonesian president wants Bali Nine men back in Australia by Christmas

image.altText: Sandstone buildings on the University of Melbourne campus.

props.synopsis: The University of Melbourne will repay a total of $72 million to more than 25,000 underpaid staff after a decade of "unlawful" conduct, as part of an agreement with the Fair Work Ombudsman.

title.children: Melbourne Uni to repay $72 million after 'unlawful' conduct

image.altText: A photo of Holly Bowles from the funeral order of service.

props.synopsis: Friends and family — some wearing pink and others with blue and yellow ribbons in their hair — have gathered to farewell Holly Morton-Bowles, who died after consuming methanol-laced drinks in Laos.

title.children: 'In our hearts forever': Holly Morton-Bowles farewelled

image.altText: An aerial shot of people walking around a road with accomodation blocks next to them

props.synopsis: School leavers allegedly assaulted tourists on Rottnest Island and pelted bottles at police, with officers trained in controlling riots and public unrest called in to help restore order on the holiday island.

title.children: Riot police swarm popular Rottnest Island to control partying school leavers

image.altText: Taylor Swift smiles and waves on stage in a purple tinsel jacket and a blue sparkling bodysuit

props.synopsis: It's been a long time coming, but Taylor Swift's Eras Tour is about to end. As the dust (and glitter) begins to settle, these numbers show how it became one of the biggest concert tours of all time.

title.children: One of the biggest concert tours in history reportedly grossed $3 billion

image.altText: A man wearing a black jacket and shirt, with a red tie, sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Siaosi Sovaleni is stepping down as Tonga's prime minister with less than a year until the country's next election.

title.children: 'Nothing personal': Tonga PM announces 'surprise' resignation ahead of no-confidence vote

image.altText: A National Assembly staff sprays fire extinguishers to block South Korean soldiers

props.synopsis: The head of South Korea's high-ranking official corruption investigation office has ordered a travel ban for President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is under investigation for his declaration of martial law last week.

title.children: South Korea orders travel ban for President Yoon

image.altText: Jay-Z

props.synopsis: Music mogul Jay-Z has slammed a civil lawsuit accusing him of raping a 13-year-old girl in 2000 along with Sean "Diddy" Combs, calling the allegations "idiotic" and accusing the lawyer behind the lawsuit of blackmail.

title.children: Jay-Z accused of raping 13-year-old girl with Diddy

image.altText: Twisted metal inside the Melbourne synagogue damaged by fire.

props.synopsis: Authorities confirm they are treating Friday's arson attack as a terrorist incident, and that it is now being investigated by a joint committee run by the AFP and Victoria Police.

title.children: Police confirm Melbourne synagogue fire being treated as terror attack

image.altText: Bradfield residents Scott and Joann Lutiger stand at the fence of their property looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Residents sitting on a parcel of land that will host a transport corridor to the new Western Sydney Airport have slammed the government's acquisition offer for their property.

title.children: Western Sydney residents slam 'disgusting' airport land offer

image.altText: Sun setting through a line of transmission towers

props.synopsis: Climate and Energy minister Chris Bowen declared "Australia is on track to deliver on our legislated targets" in his annual climate statement. But new data challenges that optimism.

title.children: The six charts that reveal Australia's (slow) climate progress

image.altText: Adeang and Albanese shake hands and smile inside the prime minister's office at parliament house.

props.synopsis: Australia and Nauru have signed a landmark new treaty which will see the federal government provide $140 million in budget and security support to the Pacific Island country over the next five years — with a condition no "third party" nation be involved in its security and key infrastructure.

title.children: Australia inks treaty with Nauru locking out growing Chinese influence

image.altText: A young man with long dark hair flowing from beneath a bucket hat stands in a house.

props.synopsis: Separate searches for Jacob Partridge, 17, and Csaba Varga, 54, are ongoing on the NSW North Coast. Jacob was last seen on Friday night and Mr Varga has not been heard from since he contacted a friend on Saturday.

title.children: Major searches for missing teen and lost bushwalker continue in northern NSW

image.altText: An aerial image of a saltwater crocodile in the water next to a reef.

props.synopsis: Swimmers are being urged to be cautious in Exmouth's waterways after three crocodile sightings in the area, which is well outside the reptiles' normal habitat.

title.children: WA tourist town records three saltwater crocodile sightings

image.altText: ABC News Breakfast - James Glenday & Bridget Brennan

props.synopsis: Glenday replaces Michael Rowland, who is leaving News Breakfast after 15 years. Catherine Murphy will take over from Tony Armstrong as News Breakfast  sports presenter.

title.children: James Glenday to replace Michael Rowland as News Breakfast co-host in 2025

image.altText: the exterior of an office building

props.synopsis: An investigation has been launched after it was revealed 323 virus samples went missing from Virology Laboratory in 2021 in a "major breach" of biosecurity protocol.

title.children: Live virus samples lost in major Queensland lab breach

image.altText: A footpath next to a road tapped of by police tape.

props.synopsis: Police said the body was wrapped in plastic and dumped on the side of a busy road.

title.children: Mystery surrounds woman's body found wrapped in plastic near Sydney Airport

image.altText: An overhead shot of three kids reading a book

props.synopsis: The government asks the auditor general to review a support program for kids with disability in early childcare education, following an ABC investigation into the scheme.

title.children: Pre-school program referred for audit after ABC investigation

image.altText: Libby French at a winery

props.synopsis: Women like Libby French are using the egg timer test to make high-stakes decisions about their fertility, but experts say it's not a reliable predictor of reproduction potential.

title.children: 'It's not predictive of fertility': The controversy surrounding the egg timer test

image.altText: Sara Jade McCullock

props.synopsis: A Perth mother who killed her 14-month-old son is found not guilty of murder on the grounds she was of "unsound mind" at the time and believed she had to do what she did to protect him from being tortured.

title.children: WA mother found not guilty of murdering son because she was of 'unsound mind'

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood juggles a ball during first Test against India.

props.synopsis: Josh Hazlewood is unsure if he will return to Australia's XI to face India in the third Test at the Gabba, as he continues to build his fitness after suffering a side strain in the series opener.

title.children: Hazlewood facing crucial '24 hours' ahead of third Test against India

image.altText: A view of the control tower next to Jewel Changi Airport in Singapore

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old Australian man faces a $5,000 fine after he allegedly told cabin crew he wanted to crash a plane at Changi Airport in November.

title.children: Australian man charged over alleged threat to crash plane in Singapore

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street in a central business district in Melbourne on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The "mismatch" when it comes to entry-level jobs locks more people into relying on income support long-term, says the Australian Council of Social Service.

title.children: 'Punishingly low' support for jobless Australians amid work shortages
